examples: During this period the movies really came of age as an art form.
The make-or-break factor in this delicate post-course period is the attitude of the person's immediate superior.
Car-rental companies are running background checks on drivers who rent for long periods.
It’s time to close the book on this unfortunate period in our history.
A place that lets them be for whatever period they choose.
words.defineEn: a duration of time
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian

examples: They got on bad terms after an argument.
The grand unified theory is compact and elegant in mathematical terms.
The deal is in the making, we're negotiating the terms.
The student submitted her term paper early, beating her classmates to the punch and impressing her professor with her diligence and quality of work.
John and Mary are on nodding terms.
words.defineEn: the end of a specific period of time, particularly one that is expected to last
words.defineVi: sự kết thúc của một khoảng thời gian cụ thể, đặc biệt là một trong đó dự kiến sẽ kéo dài

examples: While in hospital, Jeremy took stock of his life.
It took a while, but I've finally found my feet in my job.
But, it'll knock the breath out of them for a while.
His business was booming for a while, orders flooding in constantly.
Elon Musk walked the walk for the first time in a while.
words.defineEn: a length of time
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian

examples: Daytime temperatures can reach 40°C.
This medication treats the daytime sleepiness and the cataplexy.
The daytime sky had a tiny yellow ball that warmed our skin.
Two of the classic symptoms are excessive daytime sleepiness and cataplexy.
And what do you do in the daytime?’
words.defineEn: a period of time during the day when the sun shines and it is not dark yet
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian trong ngày khi mặt trời chiếu sáng và trời chưa tối

examples: It gets as silent as the grave at nighttime, and it really creeps me out.
I'm getting no nighttime.
It is nighttime right now.
And southern latitudes will have more daylight than nighttime.
For walking sticks, nighttime can be the right time to find a mate.
words.defineEn: the time when the sun is down and it is dark outside
words.defineVi: thời gian khi mặt trời lặn và trời tối bên ngoài

examples: It’s daylight robbery!
They are frightening the daylights out of people.
The crime was committed in broad daylight.
You scared the daylights out of me, yelling like that.
Stolen goods are sold unashamedly in broad daylight
words.defineEn: a period of time during the day in which there is light
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian trong ngày trong đó có ánh sáng

examples: At midday, they eat lunch.
In the midday shadow was somewhere in between.
At midday he found a quiet field and lay down under some small trees.
At about midday she heard something, and looked out of the window.
Sending kids to school during certain months of the year suddenly synced the calendars and geographic location of children right around the midday meal.
words.defineEn: at or around 12 o’clock in the middle of the day
words.defineVi: vào hoặc khoảng 12 giờ trưa

examples: She always keeps her own counsel at times like these.
At times, I feel as one with the Jesus himself.
On the other hand, the noise and pollution can be overwhelming at times.
I find Jeff's husband a bit trying at times.
But the lawyers also described internal politics that at times slowed down the department's work or drove a wedge among members of the team.
words.defineEn: sometimes, rather than all the time
words.defineVi: đôi khi, thay vì tất cả các thời gian

examples: A continuous glucose monitor sends blood sugar data to the pump.
They cause continuous itching, or horrible pain.
- They're pretty continuous, yeah.
Implantable continuous glucose monitors are out there as an alternative for some people.
It is a continuous actuator.
words.defineEn: going or being without a pause or break
words.defineVi: đi hoặc không có tạm dừng hoặc phá vỡ

examples: The same types of rocks and mountains lined up continuously between continents.
It continuously moves between neighboring bonds.
The tanks are continuously filled with fresh water from an aquifer along with a steady flow of oxygen.
We feel this way continuously for a week.
The assembly line moves continuously, and a new Vespa is ready every three minutes.
words.defineEn: without any pause or interruption
words.defineVi: mà không có bất kỳ tạm dừng hoặc gián đoạn

examples: It actually caches your fingerprint ahead of time.
The exchange itself saw it as a possibility ahead of time.
There was a lot of information ahead of time.
- We had talked about that ahead of time.
After all, no one knows ahead of time when and where a disaster is going to hit.
words.defineEn: earlier than the expected time
words.defineVi: sớm hơn thời gian dự kiến

examples: Spring came late this year.
Her latest novel takes the lid off the international art world.
The government's latest proposals are a dog's dinner.
She was only five minutes late!
The latest smartphone is now on the market.
words.defineEn: doing or happening not at the time that is usual or expected, but after it
words.defineVi: làm hoặc xảy ra không phải vào thời điểm thông thường hoặc dự kiến, nhưng sau đó

examples: Three players got their marching orders last week.
Company profits took a tumble last year.
Our cat produced kittens last week.
A wonder lasts but nine days.
That marriage won't last.
words.defineEn: to continue or go on for a particular amount of time
words.defineVi: tiếp tục hoặc tiếp tục trong một khoảng thời gian cụ thể

examples: Take your pick.
His new world record will take some beating.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
Things like this take time.
The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
words.defineEn: to need a specific amount of time to do something or for something to be done or happen
words.defineVi: để cần một khoảng thời gian cụ thể để làm một cái gì đó hoặc cho một cái gì đó được thực hiện hoặc xảy ra

examples: They're very punctual, but can't pronounce their H's.
words.defineEn: happening or arriving at the time expected or arranged
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc đến vào thời gian dự kiến hoặc sắp xếp

examples: Throughout the evening, the waiter handled the busy restaurant.
Trains between London and Brighton run throughout the day.
The question of the descent remained on his mind throughout 1598.
The weather in this city is usually mild throughout the year.
The heart pumps blood throughout the body to provide oxygen and nutrients.
words.defineEn: during something’s entire period of time
words.defineVi: trong toàn bộ khoảng thời gian của một cái gì đó

examples: The sudden noise made her start.
I got a sudden pain in my left eye.
The news of his sudden death stunned everyone.
The sudden fame has turned her head, making her behave arrogantly and disregard others' opinions.
Startled by the sudden appearance of a ghost, he let out a cry of horror.
words.defineEn: taking place unexpectedly or done quickly
words.defineVi: diễn ra bất ngờ hoặc thực hiện một cách nhanh chóng

examples: She regularly appears on TV.
They both gave regularly to charity.
We donate blood regularly at the hospital to help those in need.
Lisa hits the gym regularly to stay in shape and maintain her physical fitness.
We recommend you save regularly by clicking on the update button.
words.defineEn: at regular intervals or with the same amount of time between events
words.defineVi: tại các khoảng thời gian đều đặn hoặc với cùng một khoảng thời gian giữa các sự kiện

examples: The slow healing process of the wound required regular care.
Regular exercise is essential for the healthfulness of your body and mind.
For a gluten-free option, substitute regular flour with almond flour in the cake recipe.
A regular newsletter keeps people in touch with local events.
Regular investment of small amounts of money is an excellent way of building a nest egg.
words.defineEn: happening usually
words.defineVi: xảy ra thường xuyên

examples: The make-or-break factor in this delicate post-course period is the attitude of the person's immediate superior.
Distant water will not quench your immediate thirst, and it's important to address pressing issues first.
I'm hot on the heels of the suspect, requesting immediate backup.
He had to decide whether to continue his education and pursue his dream career or take a job offer that would provide immediate financial stability - it was a lose the horse or win the saddle choice.
Netanyahu's reaction was immediate.
words.defineEn: taking place or existing now and needing quick action
words.defineVi: đang diễn ra hoặc hiện đang tồn tại và cần hành động nhanh chóng

examples: These powers were eventually passed to municipalities.
The rumors eventually reached the President.
She eventually became a victim of her own success.
Eventually, he came face to face with discrimination again.
If you keep working so hard, the stress will eventually take its toll.
words.defineEn: after or at the end of a series of events or a long time
words.defineVi: sau hoặc khi kết thúc một chuỗi sự kiện hoặc một thời gian dài

examples: Emma couldn't handle the roller coaster ride and ended up spilling her guts right afterward.
Thompson published his findings not long afterward.
It affects their interactions afterward, too.
But afterward, in the Triassic, some amphibians still held on.
Comey hangs around afterward.
words.defineEn: after another event that has just been mentioned
words.defineVi: sau một sự kiện khác vừa được đề cập

examples: The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
But that was a long time ago.
I had a brush with him a number of years ago.
He should have been given the boot years ago.
Until three years ago, I could have slept for England.
words.defineEn: used to refer to a time in the past, showing how much time has passed before the present moment
words.defineVi: dùng để chỉ một thời điểm trong quá khứ, cho thấy thời gian đã trôi qua bao lâu trước thời điểm hiện tại

examples: Accidents like this happen all the time.
Martin was lying all the time.’
It’s difficult to do housework with the children under my feet all the time.
She claims that she rubs shoulders with royalty all the time.
Tommy, you seem to show up a day late and a dollar short all the time.
words.defineEn: constantly or continuously
words.defineVi: liên tục hoặc liên tục

examples: My mother throws that far away.
I've saved almost £100 so far.
The kangaroo can jump very far with its powerful hind legs.
The music was far too loud for my liking.
They went farther north into the mountains.
words.defineEn: away and not near the present time
words.defineVi: xa và không gần thời điểm hiện tại

examples: It's hourly.
My hourly pay right now is $7.50.
We have tripled the hourly rates.
According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, hourly wages have increased only 5 to 25 percent over the last couple decades, while the cost of renting has skyrocketed by 70 percent.
The average wage for U.S. hourly associate was more than $14 an hour.
words.defineEn: once as an hour passes
words.defineVi: một lần khi một giờ trôi qua

examples: When I tasted the vinaigrette, I was instantly transported to a sunny Mediterranean coastline.
When I tasted the hot sauce, my taste buds were instantly awakened by its intense heat and bold flavor.
The aroma of a ripe sweet orange fills the room, instantly putting me in a good mood.
He bravely took a bite of the spicy chilli and instantly felt a fiery sensation in his mouth.
Sarah introduced her new boyfriend, Alex, to her friends at the party, and they instantly liked him.
words.defineEn: with no delay and at once
words.defineVi: không chậm trễ và ngay lập tức

examples: The lawyer presented the right argument in court.
Bring Helen a present.
Bring a present for Helen.
He presented a false document as evidence in the court case.
Our hosts presented us with an embarrassment of riches.
words.defineEn: occurring or existing right this moment
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc tồn tại ngay thời điểm này

examples: The railway line runs right past the house.
The clock says ten past two.
Not a single jot or tittle goes past the eye of the boss without her noticing.
The cat ran right past me and into the house.
His past comes back to hunt him when an old friend returns to his life.
words.defineEn: existing before the present time
words.defineVi: tồn tại trước thời điểm hiện tại

examples: With the promotion, the company's future is now in his hands.
The country's future is balanced on a razor's edge.
The whole future of the project is still up in the air.
A question mark hangs over the future of the company.
If sales don't improve, the company might not have a future.
words.defineEn: coming to exist or happening after this moment
words.defineVi: sắp tồn tại hoặc xảy ra sau thời điểm này

examples: The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
Over seven hundred Facebook users have already liked the company’s website.
Important new laws are already in the pipeline.
The separation from Julie was already difficult for Alex.
Your son is in high school already?
words.defineEn: before now or a specific point in time
words.defineVi: trước bây giờ hoặc một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: The new smartphone model is currently the flavor of the week among tech enthusiasts.
The whole team is currently working on the project.
The Foreign Secretary is currently having talks with his opposite number in the White House.
They are currently drunk with success.
She is currently making a decision about which university to attend.
words.defineEn: now; at the present time
words.defineVi: Hiện nay; tại thời điểm hiện tại

examples: Will wonders ever cease?
Would wonders ever cease?
Nobody has ever made head or tail of Greek music.
Have you ever used this software before?
Have you ever looked a gift horse in the mouth?
words.defineEn: on any occasion; at any time
words.defineVi: vào bất kỳ dịp nào; bất cứ lúc nào

examples: Nothing is forever.
Who wants to live forever?
Who wants to live forever?
Let us continue in this house forever.
I know that ice cream looks tempting, but remember what they say - a moment on the lips, forever on the hips.
words.defineEn: used to refer to something that will exist for a very long time
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ một cái gì đó sẽ tồn tại trong một thời gian rất dài

examples: Our cat has just had five kittens.
Just click the link below.
That piece of work just rejected my resume for the third time!
Just hold your horses, Bill!
Alan's explanation just muddies the issue!
words.defineEn: very recently or only before this moment
words.defineVi: rất gần đây hoặc chỉ trước thời điểm này

examples: Meanwhile, her New York career hangs in the wind as it seems she's about to be passed over for a huge promotion.
Meanwhile, two of their biggest competitors, Amul and Nestlé, made nearly five billion and 750 million from dairy, respectively.
Meanwhile, those three films grossed $2.3 billion in North America and $2.5 billion internationally.
Meanwhile, in the Himalayan mountains, languages follow valleys.
Meanwhile, technology was rapidly increasing industrial productivity.
words.defineEn: at the same time but often somewhere else
words.defineVi: cùng một lúc nhưng thường ở một nơi khác

examples: Detectives had closed the book on the Hornsey Murders case three years previously.
Previously estate agents ended up as a monkey in the middle between landlord and tenant.
The Olympics can make sporting heroes out of previously little-known athletes.
Previously, the certification of the Electoral College votes was a mere formality.
So we did a video previously on Brittani's channel.
words.defineEn: before this moment or a specific time
words.defineVi: trước thời điểm này hoặc một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: The city has put the brakes on further spending.
Further details can be found on our website.
He hung tight for 50 minutes, awaiting further instructions.
I think any further intervention would be unwise at this stage of the game.
It gets colder as you travel further north.
words.defineEn: at or toward a longer distance in time
words.defineVi: tại hoặc hướng tới một khoảng cách xa hơn trong thời gian

examples: The cameras clicked away.
The water boiled away.
The clock is ticking away.
The land dropped steeply away into a small valley.
She guessed the answer straight away.
words.defineEn: at or toward a distance in time
words.defineVi: tại hoặc hướng tới một khoảng cách trong thời gian

examples: Irregular rainfall led to a decline in swamplands in many corners of the world.
But irregulars are a tiny fraction of all verbs.
The last common type of galaxy is an irregular galaxy.
Where do irregular verbs come from?
Irregular verbs on the other hand, have to be memorized.
words.defineEn: not following a regular or predictable pattern
words.defineVi: không theo một khuôn mẫu thông thường hoặc có thể dự đoán được
